reviewText: An excellent movie illustrating how a picture is NOT always worth a thousand words and you can't always believe what you see.  An innocent photograph of a mother's child is minsinterpreted by a clerk at a film store which causes harm, and a struggle to regain her family as it once had been.  Frustration at the technician who was so out of bounds, but then a reality check creeps in as in the world today, we can't become too careful or diligent. Thankfully, the truth comes to light, but it leaves one with the sad feeling on the state of the world as it is today.
summary: Great Movie about Rush to Judgment!

reviewText: First saw this on The Family Channel around 2000 or 2001. The story is about a mother who gets into trouble when some photos taken by a family-friend is developed at a photo lab.The technician decides to report the photos since it seems to portray "innappropriate" images of young girls. The mom then faces some unfair accusations regarding the treatment of her daughters.Good movie to reflect on the current state of this world. The DVD itself contains the movie trailer along with a Star Biograhies.

reviewText: This is a moving story of a mother who is wrongly accused of child pornography. She fights the justice system and wins. The sad thing is you must be careful of the pictures you take of your kids because the wrong person could interpt it the wrong way.

reviewText: This is a mild, compared to real life, portrail of how slanted the facts can be shown by those who are supposed to protect the people. This movie shows how a single parent can be targeted by the legal system of lawyers who want nothing more than to put a notch on their belt to show what heros they are while "saving the children" from those who love them the most.Well acted and realisticlly portrayed.
summary: How power filled prosecutors abuse the people.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a very powerful film. It deals with a very upsetting subject, child pornography. But the problem is, there was not anything there to start with. A mom and her kids playing around with friends, nothing more. It just goes to show you anyone can pervert a situation if they want. An opinion does not make it fact. Too often we see a negative spin on perfectly innocent situations. This is a very powerful example of just how far accusations can go with the right people involved.Add the legal system, and you have an innocent person on trial. I thought the acting was very good, and I really enjoyed the fact that this mom refused to give up and accept anything less than an acquittal. I was very pleasantly surprised with this movie. Kudos on the script, and the handling of this sensitive topic. I am very happy to recommend this film, and very happy that I watched it.
summary: Opinions are not fact. You can pervert anything pure it seems.
